summary: The Hytale Team talk hairstyles, PVP, and other content.
mainText:
Thomas Frick, Hytale's Art Director, shared on Twitter that he was working on improving as many 'outdated haircuts' as possible before release. Responding to community questions and requests stemming from that post, Thomas confirmed that the team aims at being as inclusive as possible, and will keep adding more and more inclusive hairstyles from different cultures. Additionally, Thomas stated that longer hairstyles are desired, though tech issues prevent their addition, as well as mixed hair tints - though the team is exploring tech solutions to both down the line.

Simon provided an update on PVP, stating that knockback had been 'fixed,' though wouldn't be properly balanced at launch. Additionally, he revealed the addition of an Health Bar toggle for servers. Furthermore, Simon revealed the addition of fruit trees to Hytale - though it is unclear what type of fruit trees now exist.

Responding to questions regarding playing with friends, Simon stated that, while a Friends List won't be in the game at launch, a prototype is in the works and should be implemented in the first few months. At the moment, playing with friends is done via an invite code system.

Finally, Simon shared that a few dev team members are already focused on post-launch patches and updates, adding that the team has a massive list of 'obvious' issues/updates that need to be done ASAP.

summary: The Hytale Team share The Future of World Generation (World Gen V2) blog post.
mainText:
Dan & Amber of the Hytale Team shared a glimpse into The Future of World Generation, or 'World Gen V2.'

The blog began with a brief explanation, covering the difference between World Gen V1 and World Gen V2, and briefly stating that V2 will be the primary world generator for Hytale once it is complete. The blog included many videos and screenshots showcasing World Gen V2, showcasing and explaining various features.

A major 'selling point' of World Gen V2 is the node editor system, which allows anyone to create and modify world-gen without knowing how to code. Additionally, any world-gen edits are live-reloaded in-game to reflect any changes made, allowing creators to control terrain shape, biome transitions, materials, props, and other world generation factors.

The Team also committed to publishing first-party tutorials, guides, and documentation, and (soon enough) hire over 15 World Designers, primarily from the community. Simon estimates that starting salaries for World Designers would be around $80K~$100K USD a year.

summary: The Hytale Team talk MacOS support, new mod video, new server information, and reveal World Gen V2 Blogpost release timing.
mainText:
The Hytale Team started the day off strong, with DevSlashNull (Hytale's Technical Producer) announcing that Hytale will ship with macOS support on January 13th, and will support any M-Series Macs. Simon revealed that he previously tested the game on a M1 Mac Mini with 8GB of RAM, and got ~60 FPS @ 1080P with a view distance a bit over 200 blocks. Separately, Slikey confirmed that Hytale will not support Intel Macs, as it would require separate maintenance and support.

Around 11 AM CST, Simon shared a video showcasing a server-side mod created by a team member in their spare time, featuring top-down wave shooter style gameplay, akin to Vampire Survivors. Slikey later stated that he has a long list of limitations that are critical before mods like 'Create' can be... created, and stated he'd try to post the list some time in the next week.

Slikey revealed new server information in a series of short tweets, confirming Hytale supports IPv6, does not yet have SRV records, and stated that Hytale does not currently have support for peer-to-peer custom lobbies 'yet.'

Perhaps the most important news of the day came with Simon's announcement that Hytale's World Gen V2 blog post would release tomorrow, January 5th, at 10 AM EST.

summary: The Hytale Team talk upcoming World Gen V2.
mainText:
Answering questions on Twitter, Simon revealed that the World Gen V2 blog post will be live by Monday (January 5th) by the latest, and reconfirmed that the new world gen will surpass anything seen in the blog game genre in terms of tech and usability. While World Gen V2 won't be used on early access launch, Simon confirmed that players can 'visit' it, and try out some of the biomes/tests the team made.

Simon made a follow-up tweet, intending to temper expectations after seeing comments by the community. Simon revealed that the blog will focus mainly on the tech, tools, and prototype examples to showcase what it can do and how, and won't have major screenshots/clips of the world itself. Simon revealed that only a few biomes have been made, which he says are unfinished, though he says the new world gen is designed to enable much faster creation while giving greater control.

After releasing an early look at Hytale's PVP, Simon took to Twitter to answer questions and provide details.

Simon began by noting that knockback and collision are currently missing in-game, noting rendering issues with health bars and confirming they can be disabled. Simon also noted that weapons don't currently use durability, though it can be enabled, and added that (by default) players will lose some materials and durability upon death.

Simon noted that the armor broke during the video, and thus only offered 50% benefits.

When asked about spears and other weapons, Simon confirmed many additional weapon types exist in the game, but only in creative mode as they require work/special abilities. The developer also confirmed that enchantments/other improvement options for gear do not currently exist, and mentioned that a parry system and a stagger system will probably be added later on, and a grave system will likely be re-attempted in the future.

1: Simon - General Notes on PVP video

summary: The Hytale Team release new PVP video.
mainText: The Hytale Team released a look at PVP in it's early stages. Notably, the gameplay did not use potions, food, traps, blocks, or magic, with the video noting that this is simply serving as the foundation that the team is building on.
